child_page.title: Chapter 1: Reliable, Scalable, and maintainable applications
Ch.2 Data Models and Query Languages.

text.content: Key goal for modern system engineers is to design a system that is reliable, scalable, maintainable.

text.plain_text: Key goal for modern system engineers is to design a system that is reliable, scalable, maintainable.

text.content: Ability of the system to perform as expected under varying conditions:

text.plain_text: Ability of the system to perform as expected under varying conditions:

text.content: Four main points to describe system reliability:

text.plain_text: Four main points to describe system reliability:

text.content: The Application performs the functions that the user expect - E

text.plain_text: The Application performs the functions that the user expect - E

text.content: Tolerate user mistakes or using the software in unexpected ways -

text.plain_text: Tolerate user mistakes or using the software in unexpected ways -

text.content: Performs good enough for the required use cases -

text.plain_text: Performs good enough for the required use cases -

text.content: hard-disk failure, faulty RAM, power outage

text.plain_text: hard-disk failure, faulty RAM, power outage

text.content: Redundant power, emergency power for supply for power outage.

text.plain_text: Redundant power, emergency power for supply for power outage.

text.content: The following type of fault is harder to anticipate, real-life examples:

text.plain_text: The following type of fault is harder to anticipate, real-life examples:

text.content: A leap second on june 30, 2012, that caused many applications to hang simultaneously due to a bug in the linux kernel.

text.plain_text: A leap second on june 30, 2012, that caused many applications to hang simultaneously due to a bug in the linux kernel.

text.content: A runaway process that uses up some shared resource- spu time, memory , disk, space or network bandwidth

text.plain_text: A runaway process that uses up some shared resource- spu time, memory , disk, space or network bandwidth

text.content: A service the system depends on, slows down or hangs.

text.plain_text: A service the system depends on, slows down or hangs.

text.content: Cascading faliures, where small fault in one component triggers a fault in another component.

text.plain_text: Cascading faliures, where small fault in one component triggers a fault in another component.

text.content: A human may use the software in unexpected way resulting in an error.

text.plain_text: A human may use the software in unexpected way resulting in an error.

text.content: Design systems in a way that minimizes opportunities for unexpected usage.

text.plain_text: Design systems in a way that minimizes opportunities for unexpected usage.

text.content: Decouple the plqaces where people make the most mistakes from places where they can cause failures: provide non-production environment where users can explore without causing errors.

text.plain_text: Decouple the plqaces where people make the most mistakes from places where they can cause failures: provide non-production environment where users can explore without causing errors.

text.content: Describe the ability of a system to cope with increased load.

text.plain_text: Describe the ability of a system to cope with increased load.

text.content: Load can be described with few numbers which we call

text.plain_text: Load can be described with few numbers which we call

text.content: a user published a new message to their followers ( 4.6k requests/sec on aver-age, over 12k requests/sec at peak )

text.plain_text: a user published a new message to their followers ( 4.6k requests/sec on aver-age, over 12k requests/sec at peak )

text.content: A user can view tweets posted by the people they follow ( 300k requests/sec )

text.plain_text: A user can view tweets posted by the people they follow ( 300k requests/sec )

text.content: To ways to handle this problem :

text.plain_text: To ways to handle this problem :

text.content: posting a tweet simply inserts the new tweet into a global collection of tweets. When user requests their home timeline, look up all the people they follow, find all the tweets for each of those users and merge them.

text.plain_text: posting a tweet simply inserts the new tweet into a global collection of tweets. When user requests their home timeline, look up all the people they follow, find all the tweets for each of those users and merge them.

text.content: Maintain cache for each user’s home timeline. When user posts a tweet lookup all the people who follow that user, and insert the new tweet into each of their home timeline caches.

text.plain_text: Maintain cache for each user’s home timeline. When user posts a tweet lookup all the people who follow that user, and insert the new tweet into each of their home timeline caches.

text.content: Once we describe the load on our system we can describe what happens when the  load increases:

text.plain_text: Once we describe the load on our system we can describe what happens when the  load increases:

text.content: When we increase a load parameter and keep the system resources ( cpu, ram, network bandwidth ) the same, how our system performance changes ?

text.plain_text: When we increase a load parameter and keep the system resources ( cpu, ram, network bandwidth ) the same, how our system performance changes ?

text.content: When we increase a load parameter, how much do we need to increase resources if we want to keep the performance un changed ?

text.content: Operability - Make it easy for operations teams to keep the system running smoothly

text.plain_text: Operability - Make it easy for operations teams to keep the system running smoothly

text.content: Simplicity - Make it easy for new engineers to understand the system, by removing as much complexity as possible.

text.plain_text: Simplicity - Make it easy for new engineers to understand the system, by removing as much complexity as possible.

text.content: Evolvability - Make it easy for engineers to make changes to the system in the future, adapting it for unanticipated use cases and requirements

text.plain_text: Evolvability - Make it easy for engineers to make changes to the system in the future, adapting it for unanticipated use cases and requirements

text.content: Transaction is a way for application to group several reads and writes together into a logical unit. All the reads and writes within a transaction are executed as one operation; either the entire transaction succeeds ( commit ) or it fails ( rollback, abort )

text.plain_text: Transaction is a way for application to group several reads and writes together into a logical unit. All the reads and writes within a transaction are executed as one operation; either the entire transaction succeeds ( commit ) or it fails ( rollback, abort )

text.content: Transactions simplifiy the programming model for programmers dealing with a database, ignoring potential error scenarios and c oncurrency issues, the database handle them.

text.plain_text: Transactions simplifiy the programming model for programmers dealing with a database, ignoring potential error scenarios and c oncurrency issues, the database handle them.

text.content: ACID stands for atomicity, consistency, isloation, durability.  ACID allows to establish precise terminology for fault-tolerance machinism in databases.

text.plain_text: ACID stands for atomicity, consistency, isloation, durability.  ACID allows to establish precise terminology for fault-tolerance machinism in databases.

text.content: Atomicity : refers to something that cannot be broken down into smaller parts. If writes grouped in one transaction and one of the writes fails, the whole transaction is aborted, rolledback.

text.plain_text: Atomicity : refers to something that cannot be broken down into smaller parts. If writes grouped in one transaction and one of the writes fails, the whole transaction is aborted, rolledback.

text.content: Consistency refers to an application specific nation of the database being in a good state.

text.plain_text: Consistency refers to an application specific nation of the database being in a good state.

text.content: Isolation : concurrently executing transactions are isloated from each other, they cannot step over each other.

text.plain_text: Isolation : concurrently executing transactions are isloated from each other, they cannot step over each other.

text.content: Durability is the promse that once a transaction has comitted successfully, any data it has written will not be forgotten, even if there is a hardware fault or the database crashes.

text.plain_text: Durability is the promse that once a transaction has comitted successfully, any data it has written will not be forgotten, even if there is a hardware fault or the database crashes.

text.content: Data replication is a crucial aspect of distributed systems, providing benefits such as geographic proximity, increased availability, and enhanced read throughput. This document explores various replication strategies and algorithms, focusing on leader-based replication and its challenges.

text.plain_text: Data replication is a crucial aspect of distributed systems, providing benefits such as geographic proximity, increased availability, and enhanced read throughput. This document explores various replication strategies and algorithms, focusing on leader-based replication and its challenges.

text.content: Each node storing a copy of the database.

text.plain_text: Each node storing a copy of the database.

text.content: Utilizes a single leader for write operations.

text.plain_text: Utilizes a single leader for write operations.

text.content: Take a snapshot of the leader's database.

text.plain_text: Take a snapshot of the leader's database.

text.content: Copy the snapshot to the follower node.

text.plain_text: Copy the snapshot to the follower node.

text.content: Follower requests data changes since the snapshot.

text.plain_text: Follower requests data changes since the snapshot.

text.content: Once the follower processes the backlog, it is considered caught up.

text.plain_text: Once the follower processes the backlog, it is considered caught up.

text.content: Choose a new leader with the most up-to-date changes.

text.plain_text: Choose a new leader with the most up-to-date changes.

text.content: Reconfigure the system to use the new leader.

text.plain_text: Reconfigure the system to use the new leader.

text.content: multi-leader replication sometimes called leader-leader replication, involves the use of multiple primary nodes, also known as leaders, each capable of recieving and processing write requests. The leaders replicate data between each other to stay up to day.

text.plain_text: multi-leader replication sometimes called leader-leader replication, involves the use of multiple primary nodes, also known as leaders, each capable of recieving and processing write requests. The leaders replicate data between each other to stay up to day.

child_page.title: "Time, Clocks, and the Ordering of Events in a Distributed System" by Leslie Lamport

text.content: This classic paper introduces the concept of logical clocks and their application in distributed systems

text.plain_text: This classic paper introduces the concept of logical clocks and their application in distributed systems

text.content: In distributed systems, replication alone may not be sufficient for handling very large datasets or high query throughput. To address this, data needs to be broken up into partitions, creating smaller databases within the system. This note discusses the concepts of partitioning, replication, and strategies for maintaining scalability and fault tolerance.

text.plain_text: In distributed systems, replication alone may not be sufficient for handling very large datasets or high query throughput. To address this, data needs to be broken up into partitions, creating smaller databases within the system. This note discusses the concepts of partitioning, replication, and strategies for maintaining scalability and fault tolerance.

text.content: Partitioning : Each piece of data belong to exactly one partition.

text.plain_text: Partitioning : Each piece of data belong to exactly one partition.

text.content: Scalability : The main reason for partitioning.

text.plain_text: Scalability : The main reason for partitioning.

text.content: What we call a partition here is called, The most established name is partitioning.

text.plain_text: What we call a partition here is called, The most established name is partitioning.

text.content: Shard in MongoDB, Elasticsearch and SolarCloud.

text.plain_text: Shard in MongoDB, Elasticsearch and SolarCloud.

text.content: Replication alone is not enough for scalability and high throughput.

text.plain_text: Replication alone is not enough for scalability and high throughput.

text.content: Each partition is a small, independent database.

text.plain_text: Each partition is a small, independent database.

text.content: The main goal is to distribute query load across many processors and scale throughput by adding more nodes.

text.plain_text: The main goal is to distribute query load across many processors and scale throughput by adding more nodes.

text.content: Each record belongs to one partition but may be stored on multiple nodes for fault tolerance.

text.plain_text: Each record belongs to one partition but may be stored on multiple nodes for fault tolerance.

text.content: Requires querying all nodes in parallel to find a specific item.

text.plain_text: Requires querying all nodes in parallel to find a specific item.

text.content: Like volume of paper encylospedia , if you know the boundaries between the ranges, you can easily determine which partition contains a given key.

text.plain_text: Like volume of paper encylospedia , if you know the boundaries between the ranges, you can easily determine which partition contains a given key.

text.content: Assign continuous key ranges to partitions.

text.plain_text: Assign continuous key ranges to partitions.

text.content: Boundaries can be chosen manually or automatically.

text.plain_text: Boundaries can be chosen manually or automatically.

text.content: Keys within partitions are sorted for easy scans.

text.plain_text: Keys within partitions are sorted for easy scans.

text.content: May lead to hot spots with certain access patterns.

text.plain_text: May lead to hot spots with certain access patterns.

text.content: Because of the risk of skew and hot spots , many distributed datastores use a hash fucntion to determine the partition for a given key.

text.plain_text: Because of the risk of skew and hot spots , many distributed datastores use a hash fucntion to determine the partition for a given key.

text.content: Use a good hash function for uniform distribution; A good hash function takes skewed data and makes it uniformly distributed.

text.plain_text: Use a good hash function for uniform distribution; A good hash function takes skewed data and makes it uniformly distributed.

text.content: May lose efficient range queries, as keys are scattered across partitions.

text.plain_text: May lose efficient range queries, as keys are scattered across partitions.

text.content: A way of evenly distributing load across an internet-wide system of caches such as a content delivery network.

text.plain_text: A way of evenly distributing load across an internet-wide system of caches such as a content delivery network.

text.content: Adding a random number to keys can help distribute writes.

text.plain_text: Adding a random number to keys can help distribute writes.

text.content: A second index doesn’t identify a record uniquely but rather is a way of searching for occurrences of a particular value; find all actions by user 123.

text.plain_text: A second index doesn’t identify a record uniquely but rather is a way of searching for occurrences of a particular value; find all actions by user 123.

text.content: The problem with secondary indexes that they do not map neatly to partitions. However there is solutions like partitioning by document or by term.

text.plain_text: The problem with secondary indexes that they do not map neatly to partitions. However there is solutions like partitioning by document or by term.

text.content: Each partition maintains its secondary indexes (local index).

text.plain_text: Each partition maintains its secondary indexes (local index).

text.content: Queries are sent to all partitions, and results are combined (scatter/gather).

text.plain_text: Queries are sent to all partitions, and results are combined (scatter/gather).

text.content: Construct a global index covering data in all partitions.

text.plain_text: Construct a global index covering data in all partitions.

text.content: The global index is also partitioned to avoid bottlenecks.

text.plain_text: The global index is also partitioned to avoid bottlenecks.

text.content: Useful for range scans, making reads more efficient.

text.plain_text: Useful for range scans, making reads more efficient.

text.content: Moving load from one node to another in the cluster.

text.plain_text: Moving load from one node to another in the cluster.

text.content: Strategies: Hash mod N, Fixed number of partitions, Dynamic partitioning, Partitioning proportionally to nodes.

text.plain_text: Strategies: Hash mod N, Fixed number of partitions, Dynamic partitioning, Partitioning proportionally to nodes.

text.content: After rebalancing, the load ( data sttorage, read, write requests ) should be shared fairly betweenb the nodes in the cluster.

text.plain_text: After rebalancing, the load ( data sttorage, read, write requests ) should be shared fairly betweenb the nodes in the cluster.

text.content: While rebalancing is happening, the database should continue accepting reads and writes.

text.plain_text: While rebalancing is happening, the database should continue accepting reads and writes.

text.content: No more data than neccessary should be moved between nodes.

text.plain_text: No more data than neccessary should be moved between nodes.

text.content: divide the possibler hashes into ranges and assign each range to a partition.

text.plain_text: divide the possibler hashes into ranges and assign each range to a partition.

text.content: Create more partitions than they are nodes, assign several partitions to  each node.

text.plain_text: Create more partitions than they are nodes, assign several partitions to  each node.

text.content: Fully automated rebalancing may impact network and node performance.

text.plain_text: Fully automated rebalancing may impact network and node performance.

text.content: Human involvement may prevent operational surprises.

text.plain_text: Human involvement may prevent operational surprises.

text.content: Problem: Service discovery and routing requests to the appropriate node.

text.plain_text: Problem: Service discovery and routing requests to the appropriate node.

text.content: Approaches: Client contact, Routing tier, Client awareness.

text.plain_text: Approaches: Client contact, Routing tier, Client awareness.

text.content: Coordination services like ZooKeeper used for tracking partition assignment changes.

text.plain_text: Coordination services like ZooKeeper used for tracking partition assignment changes.

text.content: Client contact : Allow clients to contact any node ( via round-robin load balancer ) if that node coincidentally owns the partition to which the request applies, it can handle the request directly, otherwise; it forwards the rewquest to the appropriate node, recieves the reply and passes the reply along the client.

text.plain_text: Client contact : Allow clients to contact any node ( via round-robin load balancer ) if that node coincidentally owns the partition to which the request applies, it can handle the request directly, otherwise; it forwards the rewquest to the appropriate node, recieves the reply and passes the reply along the client.

text.content: Routing tier: Send all requests from clients to a routing tier first, which determines the node that should handle each request and forwards it accordingly. This routing tier doesnot itself handle any requests; it only acts as a partition aware  load balancer.

text.plain_text: Routing tier: Send all requests from clients to a routing tier first, which determines the node that should handle each request and forwards it accordingly. This routing tier doesnot itself handle any requests; it only acts as a partition aware  load balancer.

text.content: Client Awareness: Require in the architecture clients to be aware of the partitioning and the assignment of partitions to nodes, in this case, a client can connect directly to the appropriate node, without any intermediary.

text.plain_text: Client Awareness: Require in the architecture clients to be aware of the partitioning and the assignment of partitions to nodes, in this case, a client can connect directly to the appropriate node, without any intermediary.

text.content: Massively parallel processing (MPP) relational databases offer sophisticated query support.

text.plain_text: Massively parallel processing (MPP) relational databases offer sophisticated query support.

text.content: These notes provide a comprehensive overview of the concepts and strategies involved in data partitioning, replication, and maintaining scalability in distributed systems.

text.plain_text: These notes provide a comprehensive overview of the concepts and strategies involved in data partitioning, replication, and maintaining scalability in distributed systems.

text.content: Applications change over time, we need to make our applications adaptable to change evolvable. Evolvability: we should aim to build systems that make it easy to adapt to change.

text.plain_text: Applications change over time, we need to make our applications adaptable to change evolvable. Evolvability: we should aim to build systems that make it easy to adapt to change.

text.content: When a data format or schema changes in applications, a corresponding change in application code is required. However, it’s very hard to make a change in production happen instantaneously:

text.plain_text: When a data format or schema changes in applications, a corresponding change in application code is required. However, it’s very hard to make a change in production happen instantaneously:

text.plain_text: In server side we might want to perform

text.content: applying the change on fewer node to see if the change is running smoothly.

text.plain_text: applying the change on fewer node to see if the change is running smoothly.

text.content: In client side, we are at the mercy of the user, who might not install the upgrade for sometime.

text.plain_text: In client side, we are at the mercy of the user, who might not install the upgrade for sometime.

text.content: Which means old data format, new data format can co-exist within the application, in order to maintain the application running smoothly we need to maintain compatibility in both directions:

text.plain_text: Which means old data format, new data format can co-exist within the application, in order to maintain the application running smoothly we need to maintain compatibility in both directions:

text.content: Programs usually work with data at least with two known representations:

text.plain_text: Programs usually work with data at least with two known representations:

text.content: In memory: data is kept as objects, structs, lists, arrays, hash tables, trees and so on.

text.plain_text: In memory: data is kept as objects, structs, lists, arrays, hash tables, trees and so on.

text.content: When you want to write data like file or send it over the network, we have to encode it, self contained sequence of bytes ( JSON document ).

text.plain_text: When you want to write data like file or send it over the network, we have to encode it, self contained sequence of bytes ( JSON document ).

text.content: Given the two representation we need a translation layer between them

text.plain_text: Given the two representation we need a translation layer between them

text.content: The encoding usually tied to a specific programming langauges, and reading data in another langauge is very difficult.

text.plain_text: The encoding usually tied to a specific programming langauges, and reading data in another langauge is very difficult.

text.content: In order to restore data in the same object types, the decoding process needs to be able to instantiate arbitrary classes. This is usually the soruce of security problems. If attacker can send a sequence of bytes to the program then, he can instantiate a class, and execute bad code.

text.plain_text: In order to restore data in the same object types, the decoding process needs to be able to instantiate arbitrary classes. This is usually the soruce of security problems. If attacker can send a sequence of bytes to the program then, he can instantiate a class, and execute bad code.

text.content: Avro supports two schema languages (Avro IDL and JSON-based).

text.plain_text: Avro supports two schema languages (Avro IDL and JSON-based).

text.content: Writer's schema and reader's schema can differ; Avro resolves differences during encoding and decoding.

text.plain_text: Writer's schema and reader's schema can differ; Avro resolves differences during encoding and decoding.

text.content: Forward and backward compatibility achieved by adding/removing fields with default values.

text.plain_text: Forward and backward compatibility achieved by adding/removing fields with default values.

text.content: Changing a field's data type is possible if Avro can perform the conversion.

text.plain_text: Changing a field's data type is possible if Avro can perform the conversion.

text.content: Schema identified and encoded in data; schema negotiation during network data transfer.

text.plain_text: Schema identified and encoded in data; schema negotiation during network data transfer.

text.content: The development of applications often involves layering one data model upon another. At each layer, a pivotal question arises: how is it represented in terms of the layer immediately beneath it?

text.plain_text: The development of applications often involves layering one data model upon another. At each layer, a pivotal question arises: how is it represented in terms of the layer immediately beneath it?

text.content: Rooted in the realm of business data processing on mainframe computers during the 1960s and 1970s.

text.plain_text: Rooted in the realm of business data processing on mainframe computers during the 1960s and 1970s.

text.content: Arises from the need for enhanced scalability beyond traditional relational databases.

text.plain_text: Arises from the need for enhanced scalability beyond traditional relational databases.

text.content: Driven by a preference for free and open source software.

text.plain_text: Driven by a preference for free and open source software.

text.content: Originates due to specialized query operations not well-supported by the relational model.

text.plain_text: Originates due to specialized query operations not well-supported by the relational model.

text.content: Evolves from frustration with the constraining nature of relational schemas.

text.plain_text: Evolves from frustration with the constraining nature of relational schemas.

text.content: Modern software development predominantly employs object-oriented programming, while databases communicate through tables, documents, and other structures. This incongruence necessitates an additional layer known as Object-Relational Mapping (ORM).

text.plain_text: Modern software development predominantly employs object-oriented programming, while databases communicate through tables, documents, and other structures. This incongruence necessitates an additional layer known as Object-Relational Mapping (ORM).

text.content: Serves as a data layer bridging databases and code, translating database entities (e.g., tables, documents) into code as classes and attributes. It acts as a crucial translation layer facilitating communication between code and databases.

text.plain_text: Serves as a data layer bridging databases and code, translating database entities (e.g., tables, documents) into code as classes and attributes. It acts as a crucial translation layer facilitating communication between code and databases.

text.content: Databases have two main objectives : store the data, retrieve the data. knowing how the internals work allows you to select the suitable  storage engine for the use-case.

text.plain_text: Databases have two main objectives : store the data, retrieve the data. knowing how the internals work allows you to select the suitable  storage engine for the use-case.

text.content: In-memory key-value hashmap facilitates swift data retrieval by storing file offset bytes for each key.

text.plain_text: In-memory key-value hashmap facilitates swift data retrieval by storing file offset bytes for each key.

text.content: Key-value pairs are sorted by key, enhancing search efficiency.

text.plain_text: Key-value pairs are sorted by key, enhancing search efficiency.

text.content: Key-value pairs appear in the order of their creation, with later values taking precedence. Provides efficient write operations.

text.plain_text: Key-value pairs appear in the order of their creation, with later values taking precedence. Provides efficient write operations.

text.content: Database breakdown into pages, each identifiable by an address or identifier.

text.plain_text: Database breakdown into pages, each identifiable by an address or identifier.

text.content: Balanced tree structure ensures logarithmic depth (O(logn)).

text.plain_text: Balanced tree structure ensures logarithmic depth (O(logn)).

text.content: B-Tree, being more mature, tends to be faster than LSM-Tree.

text.plain_text: B-Tree, being more mature, tends to be faster than LSM-Tree.

text.content: Combining several fields into one key by appending columns together allows efficient retrieval based on different criteria (e.g., first name, last name, phone number).

text.plain_text: Combining several fields into one key by appending columns together allows efficient retrieval based on different criteria (e.g., first name, last name, phone number).

text.content: Optimized for transaction processing with user-facing systems handling high request volumes.

text.plain_text: Optimized for transaction processing with user-facing systems handling high request volumes.

text.content: Challenges arise due to disk I/O bottlenecks as applications query a small number of records using indexes.

text.plain_text: Challenges arise due to disk I/O bottlenecks as applications query a small number of records using indexes.

text.content: Geared towards analytics, handling fewer queries than OLTP but with each query scanning a large volume of records in a short time.

text.plain_text: Geared towards analytics, handling fewer queries than OLTP but with each query scanning a large volume of records in a short time.

text.content: Disk bandwidth, not seek time, often poses a bottleneck.

text.plain_text: Disk bandwidth, not seek time, often poses a bottleneck.
